channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Hundreds ignore social distancing to flock to Birmingham to see Youtuber Canking
item.description: Hundreds of fans and other bloggers came together to meet prankster Canking, 17, at his 'Covid fi dead' event, flooding Birmingham city centre and ignoring social distancing measures.

item.title: Golden State Killer pleads GUILTY to 13 murders and 62 rapes
item.description: The Golden State Killer is in court to plead guilty to 26 charges of murder and kidnapping on Monday and also admitted to 62 rapes that he can't be charged for because they happened so long ago.

item.title: Insiders compare Donald Trump's private calls with Vladimir Putin to 'two guys in a steam bath'
item.description: Watergate journalist Carl Bernstein spoke with sources about months' worth of private Trump calls with world leaders, with a source calling the calls 'abominations.'

item.title: Bake Off's Prue Leith calls Britain 'class-ridden' and says the nation are also divided on food
item.description: Prue Leith has called Britain 'unbelievably class-ridden' - and the Great British Bake Off judge claims the nation is also divided between rich and poor when it comes to food.

item.title: Joseph McCann was free to attack victims due to blunders from 'unstable' probation team
item.description: McCann had been freed from prison by mistake two months before his two-week rampage fuelled by vodka and cocaine when he forced victims into his car at knifepoint.

item.title: Land Rover unveils the £42,000 Defender Hard Top van for businesses
item.description: Land Rover's upmarket alternative to 'white van man' is set to prove a hit with small businesses who want to add a bit of extra 4X4 style and capability.

item.title: DR MARTIN SCURR answers your health questions
item.description: DR MARTIN SCURR: My husband has pitting oedema and the doctor says there is no cure. Is this the case, and is it safe for him to take a long flight with this condition?

item.title: Cate Blanchett says 1970s gender issues are still relevant while discussing inequality and feminism
item.description: Miss Blanchett, 51, who has long supported gender equality in the acting world, also said that women have constantly been outnumbered by men there

item.title: Tory donor Richard Desmond is in spotlight over his bid to run the National Lottery
item.description: The Tory donor at the centre of a 'cash for favours' row should not get special treatment in his bid to run the National Lottery, Labour will tell gambling watchdogs.

item.title: Fox News reporter trapped in car by BLM protesters in CHOP zone
item.description: Fox News Correspondent Dan Springer was trapped in his car in Seattle after he allegedly shoved a protester on Monday, DailyMail.com can disclose.

item.title: Jameela Jamil insists high-profile stars are 'scared' to speak out over BLM
item.description: Jameela Jamil has claimed there are more high-profile celebrities who are 'scared' to speak out on Black Lives Matter out of fear of being 'cancelled'.

item.title: Fancy a Châteauneuf-du-PAPIER? New 'game-changer' wine bottle is made out of paper
item.description: Developed by a British company, the Frugal Bottle (pictured) is about to go on sale in this country in partnership with an Italian vineyard.

item.title: Midlands city is forced to stay under restrictions
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock today confirmed in a statement that Leicester will re-enter stricter lockdown, with non-essential shops closed from tomorrow.

item.title: Wayne Rooney 're-follows Jamie Vardy on Instagram who SNUBS former England captain's olive branch'
item.description: As the feud between their respective wives Rebekah, 38, and Coleen, 34, gears up to head to court, Jamie reportedly 'won't entertain the olive branch until this is resolved'

item.title: Chef Rob Nixon creates hybrid KFC Big Mac burger on YouTube cookery channel Nicko's Kitchen
item.description: Perth chef Rob Nixon is back with a new YouTube series called 'Fast Food Freaks' in which he creates homemade versions of iconic dishes.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Sting startles his local choir by joining socially-distanced Zoom rehearsals
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: He was forced to cancel his residency in Las Vegas. But today, Sting has cause to celebrate.

item.title: Obese man loses 350LBS without going to the gym
item.description: Zach Moore, from Florida, weighed 500lbs at his heaviest, but in December 2013 he suffered serious food poisoning that he thought at the time would kill him and that pushed him to lose weight.

item.title: Fashion houses run out of stock as Kate Middleton's lockdown looks send demand soaring
item.description: Love The Sales examined data from British shoppers to reveal how the Duchesses have impacted fashion sales throughout lockdown. Kate, 38 has been dubbed the queen of lockdown fashion.

item.title: Three wives and a man whose shirking cost him his marriage have a dust-up
item.description: As domestic arguments go, it's one that's been raging for decades, and probably with the greatest intensity. Who does, or more importantly doesn't, shoulder the bulk of the housework?

item.title: World Health chief warns we CANNOT bank on a coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Dr Hans Kluge (pictured) said it is 'possible' a vaccine will be available within a year but warned that this would not be a 'silver bullet'.

item.title: Boris Johnson unveils massive programme to construct schools, hospitals and roads
item.description: Billions of pounds of investment will be pledged to make Britain 'stronger and better and more united than ever before' in the wake of the coronavirus.

item.title: TV commentary riddled with racial bias: Alarming results from research across Europe's top leagues
item.description: The PFA have urged commentators to address their racial bias after a study revealed differences in how they describe players with different skin tones. 'Deep-rooted racial stereotypes' are promoted.

item.title: Mounds of rubbish are left in beauty spots and beaches across the UK
item.description: Police turfed out 200 people who pitched up at the Lake District National Park where they cut down trees, snapped off handrails for firewood and left litter.

item.title: Rebecca Long-Bailey: Keir Starmer's created 'avoidable mess'
item.description: The Labour leader told his hard-Left former leadership rival to resign on Thursday after she shared an online interview containing an anti-Semitic conspiracy theory.

item.title: Cirque du Soleil files for bankruptcy protection as...
item.description: Cirque du Soleil has announced is filing for bankruptcy protection, as the world's most famous circus troupe seeks to restructure its debt to survive the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Lockdown puppies sparked a cut-throat canine market of rocketing rates and outright theft
item.description: Suzanne and her three children had their hearts set on a red fox labrador retriever, and back in February they found a Kennel Club-assured breeder, Marisha Romer, in nearby Tring.

item.title: These 13 survivors are sharing their stories of what it's like to have a miscarriage
item.description: The loss of a baby, whether through miscarriage or stillbirth, is something women may carry with them all their lives. Yet it remains a taboo subject, with many often suffering in silence.

item.title: Former Liverpool defender stabbed while getting out of his car in Merseyside
item.description: Former Liverpool defender Andre Wisdom is in hospital after he was stabbed and robbed while visiting a relative. It is claimed he was robbed while getting out of his car to visit a relative.

item.title: One man is dead and another wounded after Seattle CHOP zone shooting
item.description: Homicide detectives said they are investigating after the two teenagers were shot in a white Jeep near a makeshift barrier around the Capitol Hill Organized Protest (CHOP) zone at about 3am on Monday.

item.title: Mother slashed in face and neck by stranger with kitchen knife feared she was going to be raped
item.description: Josephine Conlon (pictured) gave evidence at the Old Bailey today where Brazant is accused of attempted murder and wounding with intent.

item.title: Sir Mark Sedwill's predecessors say PM made him a 'fall guy' for ministers' failings on coronavirus
item.description: Sir Mark quit following a power struggle with Dominic Cummings, who is said to have seen the outgoing cabinet secretary as a 'roadblock' to a Whitehall shake-up.

item.title: Facebook loses $60billion in market value in two days as advertising boycott continues
item.description: Starbucks and PepsiCo are among a long list of companies to pull ads from Facebook, resulting in a drop in stock prices that erased $60billion from the social media platform's market value Monday.

item.title: Thousands of test and trace callers failed to find a SINGLE contact of a coronavirus patient
item.description: The Government said the new contact tracing system has been a success so far, reaching 114,000 Britons who may have been exposed to the virus.

item.title: Boris's rhetoric is admirable - but the reality will be much riskier, warns ALEX BRUMMER
item.description: ALEX BRUMMER: Austerity will go out of the window as billions are poured into projects all over Britain to ready the country for a post-Covid future.

item.title: Do press-ups really mean you're 'fit as a butcher's dog'?
item.description: One of the most striking pictures of the weekend was the sight of the Prime Minister prone on the floor of his Downing Street office doing press-ups. But are they really the key to fitness?

item.title: NASA designs necklace that simulates a nudge when a person attempts to touch their face
item.description: NASA is helping people to stop touching their face with a wearable called PULSE. It sends out a vibration to the wearer when their hands get too close, in a bid to limit the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Failed dementia drug can help to heal diabetes sufferers and prevent heart disease, says study
item.description: A failed dementia drug could be used to treat diabetes instead, scientists revealed yesterday. Trials have shown that BACE-inhibitors fail to have any effect on Alzheimer's despite great initial hopes.

item.title: A lung physio is the secret weapon in this 65-year-old widower's coronavirus recovery
item.description: When Charlie Coulton regained consciousness after 42 days in intensive care fighting Covid-19 - half of that time on a ventilator - he wondered if he had woken up in a science fiction film.

item.title: TikTok prankster who dived into fish tank at store if he got 2,000 likes is arrested
item.description: Kevin Wise, 26, said he plunged into the indoor aquarium at a Bass Pro Shop in Bossier City last week to follow through on a promise he made to followers on the social media platform TikTok.

item.title: Toll of 25,000 dementia patients died in just two months of the pandemic, figures reveal
item.description: Although many succumbed to the virus itself, thousands of others are feared to have died from other conditions brought on by inadequate medical care and a lack of social contact.

item.title: JOHN NAISH: Why the UK's deadliest coronavirus threat is now complacency
item.description: JOHN NAISH: Leicester has seen a surge of more than 600 cases in just two weeks, and is confronted with the prospect of an extended lockdown.

item.title: Researchers create a 'smart' mask for COVID-19 with a speaker and translation software
item.description: A Japanese technology company has developed a new Bluetooth-powered smart mask that uses a speaker to amplify a person's voice, and connects to smartphone translation software.

item.title: BLMUK says Sir Keir Starmer has 'no right to tell us what our demands should be'
item.description: Activists hit out at the Labour leader after he claimed the campaign's message was getting 'tangled up' in a row over police funding.

item.title: Boris Johnson gives the EU three months to seal Brexit deal as face-to-face talks resume in Brussels
item.description: Boris Johnson set a three-month deadline for concluding Brexit trade deal talks yesterday, as face-to-face negotiations resumed in Brussels for the first time since lockdown.

item.title: New Zealand's monster penguins had American and Asian 'doppelgangers'
item.description: Plotopterids, an extinct family of flightless seabirds, had strikingly similar bone fragments to the 'monster penguins' that lived in New Zealand more than 60 million years ago.

item.title: Sainsbury's under fire over boss Simon Roberts 'excessive' pay deal
item.description: Just days after Tesco suffered one of Britain's biggest shareholder revolts over fat-cat pay, its supermarket rival was accused of failing to align executive rewards with the interests of shareholders.

item.title: Zoo boss warns of mass animal culls without government help
item.description: The chief executive of a zoo in Leicestershire has warned that Britain faces a mass animal cull in its animal parks if the government doesn't step in and help cover running costs.

item.title: Over 100 children are found buried with coins in their mouths at lost 16th century Poland graveyard
item.description: Construction workers uncovered a gruesome scene while servicing a road in Poland - a large graveyard containing over 100 skeletons of children, some of which had coins in their mouths.

item.title: Coronavirus England: School 'bubbles' may include 240 students
item.description: Entire year groups of up to 240 children could be isolated in secondary schools to limit the number of interactions with students of other ages, reports have claimed.

item.title: Sooty star Matthew Corbett, 72, almost died from coronavirus
item.description: Sooty star Matthew Corbett has revealed he almost died from coronavirus and spent 10 days battling the infection in intensive care.

item.title: School is forced to SHUT after travellers in six caravans set up camp in car park outside
item.description: The unauthorised camp was set up in a car park yesterday, blocking a road and 'compromising' how students at Ringwood secondary school in Hampshire's New Forest can get to class.

item.title: Seagull swallows whole RAT on street in Rome in video
item.description: A hungry seagull has been captured on camera swallowing a huge rat whole in front of bystanders. The clip was filmed in Rome, Italy, which is emerging from a coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Golden retriever does PRESS-UPS at the same time as its owner in adorable joint workout
item.description: Five-month-old golden retriever puppy Atlas follows the lead of his owner Amelia Hobbs as she completes push-ups in this adorable footage. The pair complete 3 repetitions in the video.

item.title: Countryfile claims BAME people feel unwelcome in countryside
item.description: TV presenter Dwayne Fields walked through Epping Forest in Essex as he investigated the issue, based on a report from DEFRA, in a BBC Countryfile episode aired last night.

item.title: Kate Middleton beats Meghan Markle as royal lockdown influencer
item.description: Research from LovetheSales.com. has revealed that Kate Middleton out performed Meghan Markle and remained the most popular royal influencer throughout lockdown.

item.title: St. Louis couple point firearms at protesters outside home marching to demand mayor's resignation
item.description: Husband and wife, Mark and Patricia McCloskey could be seen aiming the guns at demonstrators who walked by their property in St. Louis at around 6pm on Sunday.

item.title: Coronavirus Thailand: Monkey attacks woman, others rob locals
item.description: Thousands of sex-crazed monkeys are continuing to cause havoc in the Thai city of Lopburi by attacking locals and stealing property. Around 6,000 of the monkeys are located in the overrun city.

item.title: Angela Merkel and Emmanuel Macron meet, six feet apart
item.description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel greeted French President Emmanuel Macron on a red carpet at Meseberg Castle outside Berlin ahead of the talks.

item.title: Ring video shows incredible moment a Florida woman gives BIRTH in the parking lot of medical center
item.description: Newborn Julia Anderson could not wait for her mother Susan to get inside Natural Birth Works in Coral Springs on June 19, deciding she was happy to enter the world on the front step.

item.title: Russian hacker group Evil Corp targeting US employees working from home during COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: The notorious Russian hacking group Evil Corp has breached 31 major American corporations with a new ransomware attack targeting employees working from home.

item.title: Boat owner shoved into canal by thug slams 'cowards' who attacked swans
item.description: Shocking footage showed Jeffrey Phillips, 55, being blindsided by a flip flop-wearing yob who pushed him into the water in Limehouse, east London on Friday.

item.title: Laurence Fox on acting world's 'concerted drive' to shut him up
item.description: Laurence Fox, based in London, claimed cancel culture is 'very dangerous'. It follows his appearance on BBC's Question Time in January when he claimed Meghan Markle had not been a victim of racism.

item.title: Firearms officers who killed Glasgow knifeman to be probed
item.description: The police officers involved in the shooting of a Sudanese asylum seeker who knifed six people are being investigated after they failed to subdue him with tasers.

item.title: EuroMillions winner puts 'showy' £6.5m mansion up for sale
item.description: The father-of-two spent around £6m of the £147m jackpot he and then wife Gillian scooped on the luxurious Cambridgeshire property in 2012.

item.title: Daily glass of wine or pint of beer may help stave off dementia, says study
item.description: Scientists revealed in their study, published in JAMA Open Network, that women could benefit by drinking eight times a week, and men by drinking 15 times.

item.title: Covid-19 treatment hopes dashed as trial of promising HIV drug reveals it does NOT work
item.description: Oxford University scientists pulled lopinavir/ritonavir from the RECOVERY Trial today after results showed it had no benefit on people hospitalised with the virus.

item.title: Blow for holidaymakers as Greece extends UK flight ban to July 15 despite air bridge hopes
item.description: Athens has extended its prohibition on UK flights to the country from July 1 until July 15, despite plans for it to feature on the UK's list of countries eligible for quarantine-free travel.

item.title: India bans TikTok and 58 other Chinese apps amid deadly border conflict
item.description: Chinese social media app TikTok is one of 59 applicationss to have been banned in India following the death of 20 Indian soldiers in a border dispute with China earlier this month.

item.title: Hovercraft captain stops crossing after two passengers refused to wear face masks
item.description: Hovertravel said police were called after the 5.30pm service from Southsea to Ryde on the Isle of Wight was halted after the pair became 'verbally abusive'.

item.title: Chinese student who 'threw another pupil off a four-storey balcony is charged with attempted murder'
item.description: The victim survived the fall but was severely wounded. The underage suspect is facing up to 10 years in prison after being charged with intentional homicide, which covers attempted murder.

item.title: Britain will have to pay nearly £2,000-per-patient for Covid-19 drug
item.description: California-based Gilead Sciences announced it would charge governments of developed countries $390 (£320) per vial of remdesivir. Most hospitalised patients will need six vials.

item.title: Coronavirus: World's dominant strain 10 TIMES more infectious
item.description: Scientists from the Scripps Research Institute in Florida have added to growing research into the G614 strain of the coronavirus and said it appears to have strengthened the virus.

item.title: Australian MP who praised China's handling of the coronavirus crisis is questioned by police
item.description: Properties linked to NSW Labor MP Shaoquett Moselmane were searched on Friday and he is reportedly being questioned at NSW Parliament.

item.title: Taking vitamin D supplements WON'T protect you from Covid-19, UK health chiefs rule
item.description: NHS watchdog the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) reviewed studies into vitamin D and Covid-19 and found no evidence it protects people.
item.media:description: Vitamin D helps maintain calcium and phosphate levels in the body (PA)

item.title: White Island survivor watched skin fall off her hands and fingers following explosion
item.description: Stephanie Browitt, 23, was touring the island with her 21-year-old sister Krystal and father, Paul, on December 9 along with 47 other tourists when the volcano erupted.

item.title: Hope for women who are unable to get pregnant after scientists create an artificial womb in rabbits
item.description: Researchers from the US demonstrated that the implanted wombs were capable of supporting fertilisation, fetal development and live birth - with normal offspring.

item.title: Prince Andrew: Courtiers blamed for Jeffrey Epstein scandal
item.description: The damage done to the monarchy by the Prince Andrew scandal could have been avoided if courtiers acted sooner, Nigel Cawthorne has claimed in Prince Andrew: Epstein and the Palace.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 25 new fatalities in preliminary death toll
item.description: Department of Health chiefs say the death toll now stands at 43,575 but the real number of victims is thought to be in the region of 55,000 when all suspected deaths are taken into account.

item.title: Rapist, 18, jailed after horrified parents forced him to confess
item.description: Restaurant worker Jack Evans had forced himself onto his victim and apologised by text two months later. When his parents saw the message they made him go to police to confess his crime

item.title: Mother-of-two gives herself lockdown haircut using paper scissors from the Early Learning Centre
item.description: Ruth Crilly, from Somerset, shared a 'hilarious and hideous' video on Instagram, which racked up 300,000 views, of herself cutting her hair with a pair of Early Learning Centre paper scissors.

item.title: Ian Poulter FARTS live on TV seconds after playing partner Greg Chalmers tees off in PGA Tour event
item.description: The world No.59 shot a closing 69 in Connecticut to finish 64th, but the round will be best remembered for Ian Poulter farting just after Greg Chalmers had teed off.

item.title: Nicola Surgeon hints she could BLOCK UK air bridges plan
item.description: The Scottish First Minister lashed out at the Westminster Government over plans due to be released within days to link the UK with countries with low coronavirus rates.

item.title: Teenager accused of murdering his mother in Hampshire village named for the first time
item.description: Reporting restrictions have been lifted at Winchester Crown Court after Rowan Thompson, who is accused of the murder of 50-year-old Joanna Thompson, turned 18 earlier this month.

item.title: Meghan Markle's pregnancy announcement was 'huge social gaffe'
item.description: In the upcoming book Royals At War, journalists Dylan Howard and Andy Tillett claim that Meghan Markle 'put her foot in it' at Princess Eugenie's wedding.

item.title: Johnny Depp: Libel case against Amber Heard may be thrown out
item.description: Pirates of the Caribbean star, 57, had been told to hand over messages it is claimed showed him trying to get drugs. But the High Court has now been asked to strike case out after they were not disclosed

item.title: Shocking moment two carjackers drive off in £60,000 Range Rover after they attacked mother in park
item.description: Shocking footage captures the moment the two carjackers brazenly drive off in the luxury 4x4 after attacking the owner in a car park in Moseley, Birmingham, last Monday.

item.title: Coronavirus England: New rules revealed as weddings resume
item.description: The plans are intend to maintain social distancing at weddings in England from Saturday as the coronavirus pandemic continues but will reduce the big day to little more than a formality.

item.title: Meghan Markle smiles with chef in photo from 2019 African tour
item.description: A South Africa-based luxury service company Concierge Cape Town has taken to Instagram to share an unseen photo of Meghan Markle, 38, during the Sussex's 10-day African royal tour in 2019.

item.title: Historic Grade I country manor goes on the market for £5million
item.description: The Grade I-listed Cothay Manor near Wellington, Somerset, is steeped in history stretching back to the 1400s and has been heralded as the finest medieval manor in England.

item.title: Daily walk during pregnancy could can improve breast milk
item.description: Scientists from Ohio State University say moderate exercise is enough to boost 3SL - the breast milk compound which could reduce a baby's risk of serious health issues.

item.title: Airbus to cut production by 40% and axe thousands of jobs
item.description: At the end of April, the European aerospace giant reported a first-quarter net loss of €481million while consolidated revenues fell by almost a sixth to €10.6billion from the first three months of 2019.

item.title: UK weather: Britain will be hit by five inches of rain and 50mph winds today
item.description: The Met Office has warned of flooding, train delays and power cuts today with North West England, western Scotland and Northern Ireland expected to be worst hit through the morning until 3pm today.

item.title: Campaigners slam Adidas over claims it 'cropped out' black model in advert
item.description: Critics have accused the US company of 'colourism' for apparently removing the black model from shots on their site.

item.title: Australia 'turning green' after record rainfall, NASA images show
item.description: Incredible before and after images of southeastern Australia which were taken from space shows the country turning green again after crippling drought and heatwaves.

item.title: Lily James and Billie Piper defy social distancing for picnic
item.description: The 31-year-old enjoyed a very boozy picnic with a host of her celebrity friends on Saturday but was she feeling a little congested?

item.title: Fitness influencer shows off cellulite in unedited bikini photo
item.description: Danae Mercer, a journalist and influencer who lives in Dubai share side-by-side images to her Instagram showing off her bikini body while squatting down from behind, to show how she makes use of lighting.

item.title: Katie Price's son Harvey gets 'urgent medical care' in hospital
item.description: The teenager has the rare genetic disorder Prader-Willi Syndrome, among other health complications including being blind due to Septo-optic dysplasia and he also has autism and diabetes.

item.title: Libyan refugee Khairi Saadallah, shouted 'Allahu Akhbar' before Reading 'terror attack', court hears
item.description: Khairi Saadallah, 25, is accused of killing James Furlong, 36, David Wails, 49, and 39-year-old Joe Ritchie-Bennett during the incident Forbury Gardens, Reading, Berkshire nine days ago.

item.title: Church of Scientology is sued by four women for 'attempting to cover up sexual assault allegations'
item.description: Four women, three who filed sexual charges against Danny Masterson, are involved in an ongoing law suit against Masterson and the church for allegedly trying to cover up assault allegations.

item.title: Online tool that identifies potential future coronavirus 'hotspots' could support test and trace
item.description: The tool from Oxford University's Leverhulme Centre for Demographic Science considers data on population age, density, ethnicity and social deprivation.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: I've quit Facebook - but I'll still fight for its right not to be canceled
item.description: Facebook has grown increasingly aggressive in the way it commercialises itself, and its users have become increasingly aggressive too. It's been utterly exhausting to watch.

item.title: Iran issues arrest warrant for Donald Trump over drone strike that killed general Qassem Soleimani
item.description: While Trump faces no danger of arrest, the charges underscore the heightened tensions between Iran and the United States since Trump withdrew America from Tehran's nuclear deal.

item.title: 'Child snatcher' is caught carrying off a two-year-old girl from a German park
item.description: A 44-year-old man, who has not been identified, was caught leading a two-year-old girl away from a park in Berlin on Sunday before being confronted by witnesses who forced him to return her.

item.title: Morrison's security guard holds umbrella over dog in the rain
item.description: Ethan Dearman stood in the rain outside Morrison's in Giffnock, Glasgow to shelter Freddie the golden retriever from the elements. Mel Gracie snapped the security guard on Sunday

item.title: HARRY WALLOP on the oh-so-trendy - but sometimes FATAL - drug of choice for post-lockdown revellers
item.description: Lucy, like most 18-year-olds, has been enjoying her new freedom as lockdown has eased. She has started gathering with friends in the park in North London.

item.title: Terrifying graph shows the dreaded second wave of coronavirus hitting Victoria
item.description: Chief Health Officer Brendan Sutton today said he would recommend 'anything necessary' to stop the spread after 75 new cases were reported on Monday.

item.title: Boy, 10, has a five-foot cable stuck in bladder 'for five years after sticking it into his penis'
item.description: The 10-year-old Chinese boy, nicknamed Dou Dou, inserted the metal wire into his urethra when he was five, said the child's father. The boy has recovered after medics had surgically removed the cable cord.

item.title: Missed a smear test in lockdown? Doc warns women face potential timebomb of intimate health issues
item.description: Leading Harley Street intimate health specialist Dr Shirin Lakhani, of Elite Aesthetics, Kent, told FEMAIL how changes in discharge, laxity and public hair can indicate something is wrong.

item.title: Shocking moment dancer is brutally kicked in Pakistan
item.description: The shocking attack which was caught on camera saw the Pakistani woman kicked in the chest by the man who had reportedly taken issue with the way she was dancing.

item.title: Panicked cat struggles to get down from a piano in hilarious viral TikTok video
item.description: A ginger cat's panic as he tried to jump off a piano without touching the keys was captured by a TikTok user, thought to be based in Ohio, with the clip racking up 1.2 million views in just one day.

item.title: Fury as UK still only recognises THREE Covid-19 symptoms
item.description: Professor Tim Spector, an epidemiologist at King's College London, said Britain was missing 'the majority of cases' because it was 'out of line with the rest of the world' when it came to spotting Covid-19.

item.title: Why bread DOESN'T make you fat! Fitness chef explains why eating toast won't ruin your diet
item.description: Graeme Tomlinson, aka The Fitness Chef, 31, from Aberdeen, has claimed that bread doesn't make you fat. In a post shared with his 690,000 Instagram followers, he said it's all about what you top it with.

item.title: Tyson Fury reveals he suffers hateful racist abuse 'all the time' due to his traveller background
item.description: Tyson Fury has again revealed shocking details about the racist abuse he suffers. 'I can be jogging down the road and people shout out of their car window, "You b****y pikey!",' he said.

item.title: Stunning 4-bed riverside home in the heart of Wind in the Willows country goes on sale for £4.5m
item.description: The 6,851 sq ft Islands estate, situated in Cookham Dean, Berkshire, features a late-19th-century four-bedroom house, more than five acres of land and a separate cottage.

item.title: Leicester could become first city to suffer second lockdown
item.description: Leicester could be the first British city to go into a local lockdown after a spike in coronavirus cases, Home Secretary Priti Patel said - but the mayor said the plans had taken him 'by surprise'.

item.title: Brendan Rodgers says his Leicester players are protected from coronavirus after spike in city cases
item.description: Brendan Rodgers says he is confident his Leicester players are 'protected' amid fears of a spike in coronavirus cases in the city and talk of their home games being moved to neutral venues.

item.title: Coleen Rooney 'vows to spend MILLIONS in a bid to win legal battle with Rebekah Vardy'
item.description: The wife of Wayne Rooney is said not to be afraid to pay whatever is needed, if Becky refuses to back down, as the WAGS head to court

item.title: Now wait a YEAR for your hip op: Patients face long delays for 'routine' surgery
item.description: Hospitals are facing a huge backlog of routine operations but are running at only about half their usual capacity due to the coronavirus crisis.
